benchmark_details.name: UniToMBench
benchmark_details.overview: UniToMBench is a unified benchmark that integrates the strengths of SimToM and TOMBENCH to systematically improve and assess Theory of Mind capabilities in large language models (LLMs) through multi-interaction task designs and evolving story scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve and assess Theory of Mind capabilities in large language models by providing a comprehensive evaluation framework.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The tasks designed may not fully represent the diversity and complexity of real-world social interactions.

data.source: Custom dataset with 1,025 annotated scenarios, combining questions from TOMBENCH and original scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of correct answers across various Theory of Mind tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in understanding and predicting human mental states, while errors showcase limitations in social reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative performance results between baseline models and SimToM-enhanced models on various tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation across diverse scenarios designed to assess depth in Theory of Mind capabilities.
